comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: From the GPO corner looking north up George Street. The three storey building on the left is the Bank of New South Wales (on the corner of Wynyard St), and shows clearly here www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2667027158/ and here www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2667026340/ . That strange looking contraption looks to be erecting the ‘T’ pylons for the electric tram, which opened in December 1899. So this photo could be October / November 1899 ?
